data.title: l337 5p34k
data.statement:
1337 is a well-known Coding school in Morocco, the name comes from “LEET SPEAK”, the notorious geeky language initially designed to convey ideas among insiders and prevent noobs from meddling in their conversations.
The leet speak is therefore a special language that uses digits that are graphically similar to usual characters, there are many variations, but you will be only using theses one in this challenge:
`	 'o' = 0
         'i' = 1
	 'z' = 2
	 'e' = 3
	 'a' = 4
	 's' = 5
	 'b' = 6
	 't' = 7
	 'g' = 9`
you will be given a [[N]] number of [[strings]], print the result of adding all the digits that were once characters before conversion to Leet Speak.

Example : 
speak -> 5p34k
5 + 3 + 4 = 12

testCases.title: have you heard of Lorem Ipsum ?
testCases.testIn:
1
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et DOLORE magna aliqua. Ut enim ad minim veniam

testCases.title: Validator 2
testCases.testIn:
1
quis nostrud exercitation ullamco laboris nisi ut aliquip ex ea commodo consequat. Duis aute irure DOLORE in reprehenderit in voluptate velit esse cillum dolore eu fugiat nulla pariatur

testCases.title: There is something wrong with my Keyboard !
testCases.testIn:
2
EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE
Oh! Nevermind, I fixed it!

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
2
SSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS
That was too much troubles!

data.stubGenerator:
read N:int
loop N read str:string(1000)
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[N]] for the number of strings.
<<Next [[N]] lines:>> [[strings]]
data.outputDescription: a number that is the result of adding all the digits that were once characters before conversion to the Leet Speak
